div.p: MANAGE AND CONTROL a WHOLE STATE or a BIG TERRITORY.
1. The general word for governing, administering or ordering things is zhì 治, old reading chí.
2. Wéi 為, yǒu 有, yòng 用, lín 臨, lì 蒞, lǐ 理 are polite ways of referring to the government by a legitimate ruler.
3. Nán miàn 南面, tīng zhèng 聽政, and the late jiàn zuò 踐祚 "ascend the throne and hold control" are polite ways of referring to the occupation of ruler's position by a legitimate incumbent.
4. Zhèng 政 refers to the basically bureaucratic administration of a state, practical implementation of governmental measures.
5. Shù 術 refers to the "philosophical" and political art of statecraft.
6. Xiǎng 享 refers to government of a state as a privilege enjoyed by the legitimate ruler.
7. Wàng 王 is the proper government of a state by its legitimate ruler, and term often has "idealising" nuances.
8. Jūn 君 refers to de-facto government by a ruler without any idealising or approving nuances being implied.
9. Zhuān 專 refers to the (often illegal or not entirely law-based) monopolising of power, and the word often has negative connotations.
10. Xiàng 相 refers to senior roles in government bureaucracy other than those of the ruler.
11. Sī 司 refers to administration on a scale below that of a state.
12. Shǐ 使 refers to leadership, typically of the people.
13. Mù 牧 refers to government as a paternalistic responsibility of the ruler.
典，用於掌管一個方面的事務，多為宮廷服務性官稱。
掌，使用範圍較廣，是上古掌管的通稱。
主，後接表一個方面事務的賓語。
尚，多用於服務皇帝的具體事務。
司，主掌某一方面的重大事務，使用最為普遍；後世成為政務分工的普遍用語，并成為主管機構的類詞。
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

sense.def: be the leader of; be in charge of (tasks), take responsibility for; preside over
be in charge of (things not literally governed); preside over

entry.def: Xiǎng 享 refers to government of a state as a privilege enjoyed by the legitimate ruler.

sense.def: enjoy the privileges of being a ruler over

entry.def: Shǐ 使 refers to leadership, typically of the people.

sense.def: deploy and organise the contextually determinate object (typically the people) properly
deploy and organise (the people, one's inferiors etc) properly
be administered, be dealt with, be governed
archaic or technically official, SHU: be in charge of (music) take charge of; lunheng: be in charge of (a city)

entry.def: Sī 司 refers to administration on a scale below that of a state.

sense.def: be empowered by higher authorities to be in charge of (e.g. the war horses)

entry.def: Jūn 君 refers to de-facto government by a ruler without any idealising or approving nuances being implied.

sense.def: rule over as a ruler; lord it over (subjects or a state)
run the administration; run an administration
govern the contextually determinate object; remain in charge of the contextually determinate place N so as to safeguard it
be in charge of, keep order in
occasionally: take official responsibility for the political administration
govern, take responsibility for; hold office in

entry.def: Zhuān 專 refers to the (often illegal or not entirely law-based) monopolising of power, and the word often has negative connotations.

sense.def: have sole political control in N
have the sole administrative control (in a state)
be administratively and bureaucratically in charge of (by imperial authority) 尚書"official in charge of documents"
occupy (a position) as a sinecure without really doing any work; govern as a nominal head only
maintain, be in charge of; be in firm control and take good care of
be sorted out; be dealt with
to pacify, bring peace to, look well after the concerns of; euphemistic for "subjugate"
HF 8.6.25: pursue one's political purposes, conduct government of

entry.def: Zhèng 政 refers to the basically bureaucratic administration of a state, practical implementation of governmental measures.

sense.def: administration of (some state N etc) Note: 夏政 1. administration by the Xia; 2. administration of the Xia kingdom
administration of a state, public administration; administrative measure; administrative method; administrative tasks and problems; administrative practice
the general question of political administration
the government (of a contextually determinate state) 某某國之政
administrative practice in the place N
political administration as practised by N

entry.def: Wéi 為, yǒu 有, yòng 用, lín 臨, lì 蒞, lǐ 理 are polite ways of referring to the government by a legitimate ruler.

sense.def: HF 9.2.34: be formally or effectively in charge of (a state); control (a person) 有國
come to control, come to ruler over, come to be in charge of 有國"take over govt"
be governed and effectively controlled (by one) 不足有

entry.def: The general word for governing, administering or ordering things is zhì 治, old reading chí.

sense.def: start putting N into order at the stage of S
that which is functioning well, that which is well-ordered and well-governed
proper governance, good government; proper government; matters of proper government

to reduce to order; to put in order (the administration etc); to be in administrative charge of, to deal with, take care of; to be in charge of, take administrative responsibility for; to regulate, make regular, control (as breath)
be governed; be reduced to proper order
be talented for government; be interested in government; be government-minded (治於 be more govt-minded than...)
the word chí "governing, reducing to order"
well-governed; in order thanks to good government

entry.def: Wéi 為, yǒu 有, yòng 用, lín 臨, lì 蒞, lǐ 理 are polite ways of referring to the government by a legitimate ruler.

sense.def: govern [a polity], run a government, run official affairs
govern; run the government of (a state)

entry.def: Mù 牧 refers to government as a paternalistic responsibility of the ruler.

sense.def: (of a shepherd) to shepherd, (of a person in charge) take care of (men or animals), take good care of (a population etc), be responsible for the welfare of (the people etc)

entry.def: Wàng 王 is the proper government of a state by its legitimate ruler, and term often has "idealising" nuances.

sense.def: ruling as a king, kingly rulership
不王 "be unkingly in one's behaviour" engage in government as a king; act properly as a king; be kingly in one's behaviour
gain royal supremacy, come to reign supreme; become a king, get to rule as king; become a proper king
(come to/get to) rule over something as king

entry.def: Wéi 為, yǒu 有, yòng 用, lín 臨, lì 蒞, lǐ 理 are polite ways of referring to the government by a legitimate ruler.

sense.def: sort out properly, take care of; deal with; work on
be governed, be sorted out properly

entry.def: Wéi 為, yǒu 有, yòng 用, lín 臨, lì 蒞, lǐ 理 are polite ways of referring to the government by a legitimate ruler.

sense.def: govern (a state, as prime minister etc); be de facto in charge of
be in charge of (punishments and like); take charge of, take responsibility for (duties that need to be performed)

entry.def: Xiàng 相 refers to senior roles in government bureaucracy other than those of the ruler.

sense.def: be in charge of, oversee (e.g. a state, or a clan/family)
be formally in charge of the contextually determinate object
KNOW ALL ABOUT> be fully in charge of, be formally and politically in charge of
be established as ruler[See also ESTABLISH][CA]
middle voice: be established as ruler
harmonious government system, comprehensive government system
government of N, regular administration of N
govern well, govern properly; deal with efficiently as the person responsible

entry.def: Zhí 職 refers specifically to official public duties that are part of one's public office.

sense.def: perform one's administrative duties, attend meetings
judge; attend to (matters of government), conduct (government); supervise

entry.def: Wéi 為, yǒu 有, yòng 用, lín 臨, lì 蒞, lǐ 理 are polite ways of referring to the government by a legitimate ruler.

sense.def: deal with administratively; deal with effectively; come to be in effective control of, dominate; take spiritual charge of

entry.def: Wéi 為, yǒu 有, yòng 用, lín 臨, lì 蒞, lǐ 理 are polite ways of referring to the government by a legitimate ruler.

sense.def: be formally in charge of, deal with (administrative matters); sometimes used as a success verb: deal effectively with, govern properly, lead with natural authority

entry.def: Shù 術 refers to the "philosophical" and political art of statecraft.

sense.def: method of government, art of government, statecraft; political philosophy, philosophy of government; professional skill in government
method of government, art of government, professional skill in government
(of human relationships) be (not) in good order
LIJI 5.10: put (bells) in good order; GY: improve (a person) through instruction�
enjoy (the benefits of ruling a state), enjoy the position of a ruler of
legal system and government> public administration

entry.def: Nán miàn 南面, tīng zhèng 聽政, and the late jiàn zuò 踐祚 "ascend the throne and hold control" are polite ways of referring to the occupation of ruler's position by a legitimate incumbent.

sense.def: govern as king feudal lord; occasionally by extension: act in place of a king
govern as a shepherd does his sheep
administrator of the state> chief administrator
hold the handles of government> be in political control
conduct government, be in practical charge of government
conduct government; be in charge of the government (of a contextually determinate state)
those who are in effective control
take personal charge of the affairs of government; take charge of (a business)
attend to government of one's state
attending to government of one's state
handles of government of a state
walk along a certain way > govern oneself
sort out with proper administrative care
take charge of, be in charge of; administer; accept responsibility for
order about; be in charge of
order about; be in charge of
governing a state; the government of a state
take charge of a bureaucratic administration of the contextually determinate N
punishments and appointments; application of punishments and honorary titles
direct and be in charge of
"make politics >" engage in the administration of a state, participate in politics
be in charge of the state, run the state; rule the state
dominate with natural authority; hold sway over
